taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe gaillardiinae;genus helenium;species microcephalum;variety oöclinium

bio:treatment.description: Plants 25–80 cm. Leaves: proximal and mid blades serrate to undulate-serrate to occasionally deeply toothed or laciniate, glabrate; distal blades glabrous or sparsely to moderately hairy. Heads 20–100+ per plant. Peduncles 1.5–8 cm, usually projecting terminal heads well beyond foliage. Involucres 8–12 × 8–12 mm. Ray florets 9–13; corollas usually yellow throughout, sometimes reddish proximally and yellow distally, 2.7–9.1 × 1.5–6.7 mm. Disc florets 200–400+; corollas 1.7–2.4 mm, lobes 5. Pappi 0.4–0.7 mm. 2n = 26.
Sandy or clay soils, ditches, washes, around ponds and lakes, along streams;
Tex.; Mexico (Coahuila, Nuevo León, Durango, San Luis Potosí).
